revised_title: On the Formation of a Second Modified Hydrate of Sodic Sulphate in Supersaturated Solutions of Glauber's Salt
tldr: The author investigates the effects of low temperatures on supersaturated solutions of Glauber's salt and discovers the formation of a second modified hydrate of sodic sulphate. This hydrate forms at temperatures below 26°F and has unique properties, such as opaque white crystals and the ability to cause a rise in temperature during crystallization.
